resources.string: Beware the Blight, stranger. The forests of Edengrove are hazardous enough during normal times.\n\nAnd to be clear, these are not normal times.
Welcome, brave one. Edengrove is a place of great beauty, but it's not for tourists.\n\nIt's one of the most deadly territories in Aeternum, especially now with the Blight having taken hold.
I actually believed we made some diplomatic progress, before the Blight cropped up.\n\nIt threatens all life in Edengrove, human and Angry Earth alike.
While you were mixing that tincture, I studied the samples you recovered.\n\nI begin to see a pattern, but I need to study an Angry Earth specimen that's resisted the Blight.
You've been critical to my efforts thus far, though I know your true aim is to battle Corruption.\n\nI do believe this is all somehow related however, brave one, if you'll humor me.
I've only just arrived here. I need to get my bearings before I start work.\n\nI hope you'll excuse me, for the moment, at least.
I studied the samples you brought me for hours, trying to force them to make sense. I had a revelation!\n\nI believe I finally understand the Blight's origins, and perhaps its ultimate purpose.
I believe our work together has yielded great benefits, brave one.\n\nTogether, perhaps we can turn the tide against the Blight and this foul Corruption.
The Blight may be as much a blessing as a curse, but it's still a threat, particularly to the Angry Earth.\n\nIt seems it has even reached the Garden of Genesis.
I have great hope that what we've accomplished by restoring the Garden of Genesis will mean great things in the future.\n\nBe well, brave one.
You should have chosen the Marauders, friend. Unless you happen to like being chained down. Some people do.
Hey, pal. I can tell just by looking that you're a person who appreciates life's true joys. That's why you're a Marauder.
Hey, pal. I can tell just by looking that you're a person who appreciates life's true joys. That's why you're a Marauder.\n\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
Oh, you're not in the Syndicate? I think I'm supposed to shun you. Yeah, I think I remember that from the orientation.
When we pull together, we can do anything! We're the Syndicate!
When we pull together, we can do anything! We're the Syndicate!\n\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
You know, it's not too late for you. It's never too late to embrace the light of the Spark.
What? Oh, hello. I assume you're here to embrace your sacred duty to the Covenant? Good, good.
What? Oh, hello. I assume you're here to embrace your sacred duty to the Covenant? Good, good.\n\n[ Level 49 required for Edengrove faction missions ]
Well now, I hope you haven't come to Edengrove to enjoy the seasonal foliage.\n\nThis is not a season for such pleasures.
Always good to see a fellow Warden walk through those gates.\n\nWe've been watching the Corrupted make advances into the forest, but we've yet to stop them.
My hope is that we hit these crimson-eyed bastards so hard that THEY have nightmares about US.\n\nWhat do you say we take down their leaders?
Oh yes, I'm already hearing reports of the Corrupted withdrawing from some sectors.\n\nWay to show them what for, Warden! You've turned things around.
If you have no business with me, then move along.
I know the Soulwardens are here because of the Corrupted.\n\nBut you should also know that here, perhaps more than other places, the Ancient Guardians are a threat as well.

Unlike these other Wardens, you've proven that you're not just here to battle the Corrupted. There are many threats to humankind.\n\nPerhaps that means it's safe to share some of the Rangers' secrets with you.
The Survivalist, Ellwood, made mention of your bravery. \n\nIt seems he's taken such a shine to you that he left a message for you when he left.
The Rangers will always be at your back, even if you turn and see nothing.
I heard about what you achieved with Madaki, you know.\n\nShe even sent me some of the designs to decrypt - an impenetrable Tower Shield, in fact.
Though the forest is sacred to both the Angry Earth and the Rangers, it is no crime to chop down a tree.
Ah, you are the one who decrypted the Corrrupted's weapon recipes with Ranger Madaki.\n\nI was actually able to translate the formulation for a massive Greataxe.
There is no natural system more complex nor more mysterious than the human mind.
As much as I have a deep appreciation for nature, I believe human ingenuity is a miracle in its own right.\n\nThink of all we've accomplished across history. It's magnificent.
I've walked this territory for more years than I can count, but I've never seen the Grove in such chaos. Be careful as you wander this place.
You're the one who's worked with Madaki, aren't you?\n\nYes, I've heard all about you. I also managed to discover a design for a legendary bow, if you're interested.
I've heard this place was the seed of all life on Earth, that it was a paradise at some point.\n\nDangerous as it may be, I think I kinda get that.

You want to know what I think? I think the Angry Earth are just biding their time.\n\nSoon as we defeat the Corruption, they'll come for us. I trust these tree-things any farther than I can throw 'em.

Survivalist Ellwood is telling everyone now that the Angry Earth can help fight the Corruption, and the Rangers actually seem to be falling for it! \n\nNo one wants to see the truth - the Angry Earth is FAR more dangerous in the long run.

Even with the creature diminished, we must be vigilant with these botanical fiends.\n\nMark my words - as soon as the Corruption is truly subdued, the Angry Earth will emerge as the greatest threat we've ever known.
Don't tell the other Wardens, but I think we've been getting a little Blight in our rations.\n\nI just hope it doesn't make us all sick.
You there! I have need of someone light of foot. I have an urgent message bound for Reekwater to the South.
Sometimes at night, the forest will suddenly get so quiet that it's almost impossible to sleep.\n\nI like some kind of background noise, you know.
I joined the Soulwardens to battle Corruption, not dither about in some forest.\n\nSo far, I've killed more mosquitos than Corrupted.
Ah, you picked a wonderful time to visit the Hearthhome! Nature is at it's most beautiful right now.\n\nPlease come in and make yourself comfortable.

Welcome to the Dusty Coin. I'm the purveyor of this luxurious establishment.\n\nOur one and only room features four plush cots, some with "vintage" blankets. At least one of them has been laundered. Take your pick.
Fine day out, isn't it? A little humid, but fair weather for Edengrove.\n\nHow can I help you?
Doo doo doo, I'm Master Fisher Davies…
Ach, very well, very well. I guess this is supposed to prove a point that there's more to find in the water than just fish?
Thank you. Your help has been invaluable, friend. I'd say you're ready to catch most any fish in Aeternum.
There's a place I know that might interest a glory-seeker like you.

string.speaker: Auberon Gowering - Edengrove
string.comment: Seam = short for POI Name "Profane Seam"
string.name: AuberonGowering

resources.string: If you're headed up to the Seam, give those Corrupted a good thrashing for me.
What a mess. All my miners, chased off or Corrupted. My foremen turned on me. All that I invested to get this operation up and running-- gone!\n\nMakes a man feel proper powerless, it does.
Ah, you're back. Just in time, too. I heard some rumbling from the mines and if I know my business-- and I do-- they found it.
Don't fret on my account. I arrived on this island dressed in rags and penniless, just like everyone else. It's as you said-- I can start again.

There is something strange going on over there, traveler. My daughter spent mere minutes among them and now will not stop talking about this cult of theirs.\n\nFor shame, preying upon a lonely young woman.
I knew I should have kept a closer eye on her… Oh! Apologies, I did not hear you approach.\n\nIf you have come to inquire about fine silks, I am afraid I am unable to take new requests at this time.
When you say I should be worried… the mind can conjure up any number of things. I need you to be specific and honest with me. Where is my daughter?
Liu came to me just now, positively bursting with news. I cannot even tell if the cult allowed her to speak to me, but I think I may have only made matters worse.\n\nI do not know what to do.
You made it back! Quickly- is my daughter with you? Is she well?

Your presence is… something. This is not a favor I would have ever dreamed of asking, but you have exceeded every hope and expectation I have had. For that, I am in your debt.\n\nFor now… we watch. We wait.
Judging by your demeanor, you do not have bad news for me. I will take that small comfort. Continue doing what it is you are doing. Where my daughter goes, walk with her in my stead.

I came as soon as I heard about this 'final rite' of theirs. I had to see myself, and I feared Han Liu may try it, as motivated as she can be sometimes.\n\nI am immeasurably grateful that she did not, but…
At least she is speaking to me again. It is a small consolation, but perhaps in time I will get through to her.\n\nAnd if not… I will see this cult dismantled, even if I have to do it myself.
I can't put it to words, truly, but there is… something grand here. A universal truth. A great knowing. \n\nThat sounds ridiculous, but perhaps you felt it too?
I did not expect to see anyone else on the road. I admit, it gives me comfort. These creatures make me nervous.
Wait… those seeds in your hand. Are you also walking the Path of Truth?
It is such a comfort to have another traveler beside me. This is my first adventure on my own, truth be told.
Look at my arm. See how the hair stands on end? I am RADIATING energy! \n\nAre we to travel together once more?!
My heart and mind are full to bursting and there's still so much left to learn! So much of it is… intangible. I feel I am connected to something greater than myself, but what is it?
There is so much we do not know about this place, its denizens, and our role among them. The High Sage tells me he has some lessons planned for us.\n\nI cannot wait!

We did it! I was terrified the whole time. I searched for dryads around every corner, but mysteriously there were none.\n\nI am not one to spit a blessing in the face. We are here now and our future is bright!

While you were fetching herbs, I was given the privilege of washing the rite-goers feet! It was terribly formal and grave. Significant.\n\nIt gives me chills, and I hope to stand where they do some day.
Perhaps the other two are merely delayed…?\n\nAt least one returned. Judging by his demeanor, it must have been a deeply meaningful experience. Oh, I cannot wait for my own!

Try not to tell the others what you told me, about the gold. They may think you are not dedicated to the cause. I would hate to see you excluded after all we have accomplished together.\n\nHave faith, my friend!
As complex as our relationship may be, I am glad my mother is here. She and I have been through so much together. Eternity would be rather lonely without her.\n\nThank you for this gift.
You have a look about you. A certain… hunger.\n\nFar be it from my place to presume but if it is purpose you desire, I encourage you to speak to the High Sage. He is just inside.
Ah, a fellow seeker. Welcome to the home of the Cult of Renewal. The High Sage will be among us shortly. In the meantime, how may this High Seer be of service?
I see you have chosen to return to us. I speak for all of when I say how glad we are. Now, how can this High Seer help you?
I regret that you could not see Miss Liu off. I hope she returns to a familiar face like yours. There is no greater pleasure after a long journey.
Until you have planted the seeds, I am afraid we cannot continue to discuss your inclusion into our enclave.

I see Miss Liu has found her way back to us. I do not suppose you had anything to do with that?\n\nDo not worry. A shared trial is quite in the spirit of our ways. Now, however, we stand at another crossroads.
How fare your studies? Have you gained a better understanding of our ways?

The High Sage is a very busy man. I would not dream of discouraging you from speaking to him; he is the source, after all. But do bear in mind that I am also equipped to answer any questions you may have.
Three are about to leave for the final rite. Soon they will go into one of the most sacred places in all of Edengrove and commune deeply with the heart of this place.
They are soon to depart, once they have taken their tea and had a moment to meditate. I feel strongly that this group will succeed.\n\nYou can help me prepare a small celebration for their return.

As you have likely noticed, only one of our rite-goers has returned. This does happen, and more often than not.\n\nDo not mourn them. Their convictions carried them to the end. Their sacrifice is not in vain.

As grave as this task was, I hope you found the significance of what we are trying to accomplish. Only the most devoted ever seek to undertake this rite, and so they would not want us to waste their efforts.
Rest, contemplation, and meditation is in order for all of us. Our most recent Exalted will need time to recover from their ordeal, after all.
Miss Liu brought us not only herself, but three new members of our order. An auspicious start.\n\nAnd you. Your contributions are to be noted. Your future is bright indeed.
Welcome, traveler, to the home of the Cult of Renewal.\n\nYou will notice we have little to offer, but you may make yourself at home.
The High Seer told me you were hovering about. Do not be shy. We are all equals here.
While the High Seer will almost assuredly push you toward this trial or that, I want to remind you that you may undertake this journey at your own pace. Why rush? Enlightenment cannot be forced.

You delivered the oath well, strong and true, but I see in your eyes that some uncertainty about us and our cause lingers. That is normal, at this stage. I hope in time you will grow to feel welcome here.

You are advancing with auspicious speed, my friend. Is it hunger for more, or are you driven by the idea of earning your place here?\n\nIf it is the latter, I encourage you to relax. You are one of us.

While I mourn each soul that we lose, I cannot help but feel my heart swell with pride at every individual that returns to us.\n\nJust look at him. He is transformed. I wish this for all of us, including you.

With each sacrifice, we gain more in trust, purpose, and understanding.\n\nIt is a long road to comprehending all that we hope to be, but I am glad that you have chosen to join us on this journey of ours.
What a fine day for foraging. Agreeable weather, yes?
Greetings, my fine friend. You seem like the sort of person who might take on a task for a humble mycophile. Do you have a moment?
While these cook, may I make another request? Before you ask-- yes, I would like more mushrooms. These will be harder to procure, but I trust you are most capable.
Death is such a profound experience. Painful, yes, considerably, but there is a moment right before all goes dark where marvelous things appear in the mind.\n\nI am inspired, and do you know why?
I am still pondering the mystery you uncovered. I will know the truth myself, once my stew has finished cooking.\n\nThank you, and I hope you find your own mystery to enjoy.
A pile of haphazard journals and loose pages rests atop an empty foraging basket.
The top-most page bears a crude drawing of a mushroom and an arrow pointing toward the open end of the basket. There appears to be some cramped text beneath the drawing.
Be mindful of the denizens of this jungle. No doubt you have already experienced their ire.
Ho there! I could use a helping hand. I have run into some trouble on the wild road.
Before you go. When the Angry Earth attacked, they took most of my things. \n\nMy cooking supplies, my map, my food. Everything except the tent and my bow really.
Did you happen to see my wolf companion on your way back? He was behaving so strangely, it is like nothing I have seen before.
Where is he? He has never strayed from me before…
You are welcome to my fire and the contents of my cookpot. You need only ask.\n\nI am sure Scout feels the same way. He really enjoys his name. Wags his tail whenever I say it!
[The wolf looks at you with a steady, piercing gaze.]
[The wolf wags his tail once in acknowledgement of your greeting.]
[Scout sits patiently and stares at you with an unmistakably expectant look in his eye.]
As I said, I cannot return the bow to you. Though Sai cannot know this, it is a grave affront to touch a dryad's bow, let alone wield it. They are grown from their bodies, and act as another limb.
[Scout winks at you.]
Do you smell that? A sort of… floral wafting. It tickles the mind more than the nose.\n\nOh, if you are looking for the outpost, it is up the road a ways.
You there! Cover your nose immediately!

Wait. WAIT. Do not go. I need your help.

This is going to sound like insanity. I cannot go back to the outpost, but I need--Look at me.-- NEED to find her.

Please help. I beg of you.
She must not know I am here. Yes… why else would my love fail to appear?\n\nI must find a way to signal her!
I am unworthy of her love. I will die here. I know it like I know my own bones.\n\nPlease leave me to die.
This misery is all consuming. I feel my spirit slipping away, moment by moment.\n\nYet… I do not want to die.
You humans, always making such a mess of things. What will it take for you to realize this is not your forest to conquer?
Well, if it isn't the petty thief. Come to help yourself to more of my garden?
If you are in the habit of accepting errands in exchange for coin, I have another task for you.
I no longer require your services. Our relationship has thus concluded and you may go.\n\nDo not forget that these are our trees, and this is our jungle.
What did you expect would happen, inviting flame into the green places cultivated by the Angry Earth?\n\nOur time together has been brief, but even I am shocked by this foolishness.
If you intend to linger here, I have one more task for you. How adept are you at climbing? I find your kind possess this skill to a greater degree than mine.
I am not adept at reading human emotion, but it appears you have encountered something concerning in your travels.\n\nCuriosity demands that I ask.
Do not mistake my earlier willingness to exchange coin for services as a gesture of good faith. This is not your home.\n\nReturn to wherever it is you have come from.
Here I stand, in the cradle of creation, amongst the beings arisen from mother Earth itself. It is awe-inspiring.
Hello, stranger! Have you come to learn from the High Sage as well?
Another newcomer! Between you and ah-- Miss Liu, was it?-- I do not feel quite so out of sorts.\n\nI am eager to learn what comes next. This place is so very mysterious!
You made it! Look at us! Did the High Seer say the trust thing to you as well?
I'm told there will be tea. It is all so grave and ceremonial. I am trying not to smile too much. Very serious.
If you can, you must listen to one of the High Sage's sermons. The way he sees life… our purpose… it changed me. Perhaps it will change you too.
Yours is not a face I have seen before, but I will let you in on a little secret. I hear the High Sage is due to make an appearance today. You will not want to miss it!
I will not lie to you. I was not certain if you or Miss Liu could complete the Path of Truth. It turns a great many away, but those who return? Well.\n\nYou are one of us now. Be welcome.
I remember my own Umbrage trial. Would you believe it if I said I perished during it? Only on my third attempt did I reach the summit and depart unscathed. \n\nConsider me impressed.
Now that I stand here, peering into those dark trees, I feel a terrible sense of dread.\n\nThis fear is a mere distraction. Surely the tea will help, as intended.
Do not let the robes deter you. They are quite comfortable.\n\nOthers think us strange, but if there is anything I have learned on my journeys, it is to listen first, and judge later.
I know that look. A little overwhelmed, a little uncertain. There is no need. You will find only kindness here. How can I put you at ease?

I heard that you and Miss Liu took the oath! I am very pleased. One of the greatest pleasures in life is sharing what one has learned with others.\n\nIf you have questions, please do not hesitate to ask.
Each trial marks our achievement among the cult, this one second only to the rite my fellows and I are about to endure. I consider it a privilege to stand here, don't you?
I am ready, come what may. The tea may help, but I do not need it. \n\nNo, my heart is already open. Let there be more for the others.
I cannot put into words what I saw, what I felt. I see, now. I understand our purpose.
The glossy, thick pages are well preserved. The thick tome rests open on a page with an embossed title:\n\n"The Oath of Renewal"
The glossy, thick pages are well preserved. The thick tome rests open on a page with an embossed title:\n\n"The Oath of Renewal"
